Subject:- Security vetting of designs, construction of new facilities and
alteration to existing design and facilities at Indian airport.

In exercise of powers conferred under rules 16 to 18 and 62 of the Aircraft
(Security) Rules, 2023, the Director General, Bureau of Civil Aviation Security, for
the purpose of the safety and security of passcngers, crew, ground personnel
and general public in all matters relating to safeguarding against acts of unlawful
interference with civil aviation, lays down guidelines and checklist for design
security vetting, final security vetting of new facilities and alteration of existing
facilities at Indian airports.

2. Scope:

This document lays down the broad guidelines for security vetting of design,
masterplan of new facilities and alterations to existing designs and other such
structural modifications having ramifications for the aviation security and
established principles.

3. Purpose:
3.1 To provide a uniform and standardised guidelines/checklist to ensure that
established aviation security procedures, practices and processes have been
integrated into the design.

3.2 To provide the airport operator and security vetting committee, an indicative
checklist, for standardised assessment during security vetting to ensure that
established aviation sccurity procedures, practices and processes are being
complied with.

Timeline:

Alter receiving the requisition for design stage vetting/final security vetting
from airport operator, the concerned Regional Director shall farm » Standing
Committee in accordance with para 4.1 of this document and issue orders at
least 7 (seven) days prior to date of assembly of the committee. The
committee shall assemble and conduct security vetting at the prescribed
place. The observations of the committee shall be communicated to airport
operator within 7 days (brown field)/ 15 days (green field) from the date of
assembly of standing committee.

On receipt of compliance report, submitted by the airport operator, the
committee shall again assemble to assess the compliance and submit the
proposal with recommendation(s) to the BCAS HQ within 15 days of receipt
of the compliance report from airport operator.

BCAS HQ shall examine the proposal and procece the cace for orders of
competent authority. In case of any observation /deficiency the same shall be
returned within 10 days to the-concerned Regional Director for rectification.
If the proposal is found to be in order, approval of the Competent Authority
shall be issued within 15 days from the receipt of the proposal.

The checklist for security vetting is attached as Annexure-I. The Annexure-I
4s sub divided into major areas and the particulars to be examined in that
area during the security vetting exercise of the airport. The committee
shall obtain a separate blow-up sketch for each of these areas and ensure
that these particulars have been planned/marked/available on sketch as
the case may be. The particulars enumerated are indicative and not
exhaustive, the committee may incorporate additional recommendations
based on uniqueness and risk assessment of the airport being vetted.
